1122.content:
Arturia wakes up feeling groggy; slowly she remembers how she got knocked out. She remembers that she was fighting an Assassin class servant with a strange arm before the Servant managed to avoid her attack and she was slowly absorbed by a strange dark portal. As her green eyes adjust to the darkness, she notices she is in a cave large enough to store several houses. She is also strapped to what seems to be a chair if could be called that. The reason why is the black chair felt…alive somehow. She felt a rumble beneath it similar to that off a pulse. Suddenly she hears a sound of something opening and closing then the sounds of footsteps. Could it be Assassin?
Trying to stand, Arturia Pendragon finds that she barely the strength to do so. Her mana must have been drained! Deciding to save her remaining energy, Saber sits back down waiting for the owner of the footsteps to come closer. Finally, the form comes closer and it is someone she recognized as soon as she saw the person’s face.
“Sakura? Is that you?” Saber says in astonishment. The girl that clung to her Master looked like a completely different person. Her long purple hair was now white as snow and her eyes were crimson, Instead of the normal clothes the knight was used to seeing her in she was wearing was black with red veins the dress however failed to cover her legs and spread out like cut strips of paper. She was wearing no shoes, walking toward Saber barefooted.
“Good morning Saber, or should I say Arturia Pendragon?” Even the girl’s meekness has disappeared. In its place there was confidence. Saber was surprised at her new name being revealed just as much the change to Sakura’s appearance. It takes the faithful knight a few seconds to process what’s going on before speaking.
“I am correct to assume you are Assassin’s Master, Sakura?” Saber assumes and Sakura nods, not surprised by the knight’s deduction skills. “Then why am I still alive?”

Saber is wondering why she is still alive. If Sakura still wanted the Grail she would need to cull the competition so why was she still here in this plane of existence?

Sakura giggles at Saber’s question as if she asked why the sky was blue,” As you know Assassin class servants are not very strong and Berserker is a very strong Servant. It would stand to reason I would require a very strong Servant as well wouldn’t?”

“And you think I would betray my Master and Serve you?”

“Yes, I know how loyal you are to Senpai,” Sakura says with a cruel smile. “But I need you, the Grail needs you.”

“Wha-?”

“The Grail has chosen you as its host Saber.” Sakura continues as if she is hailing a prophet from on high. “Only you can give birth to it. When you do your whole world will change, trust me.”

“Give birth? What are you saying?!” Saber spouts as she forces herself to stand. But it takes all her strength to stand, she cannot approach Sakura yet alone take a step or else she will fall flat on her face. Has Sakura lost it? The Holy Grail is an object not a thing of flesh and using her to grow it? Barbaric!

Sakura approaches Arturia and lightly pushes her. That is all it takes for the knight to fall back down on the black chair which now has red pulsing veins running through it. Saber tries to raise her arms but finds they are now stuck like glue to the chair. Her clothes and armor are not only stuck to it but her skin, her entire arm, her entire body is stuck like glue!

“Saku-UMP!”Before Arturia can say anything a black sludge similar in color as the chair enters her mouth. The taste is vile and bitter, tasting like corruption itself! Sakura smiles as Saber is forced to swallow the sludge, caressing her face as the chair slowly covers her body.

“Don’t worry when you wake up, you will feel absolutely refresh. I promise.” Sakura say as Saber’s green eyes are covered and leaving her blind.

*Some time later*

Saber was trapped in a void filled with endless suffering, endless violence, and the eternal evil of mankind. It was there that she learned the truth. The world was evil and disgusting. Her end was just another stepping stone for that evil, why do it all over again only for the cycle to repeat itself?
It needed to be restarted and be born anew. She, Arturia Pendragon, would be the one to do by giving birth to a new life that was far superior to any foolish human being.

Outside, Arturia’s black and veiny cocoon that she was entrapped in slowly started to come apart piece by piece as Saber’s new form showed itself.

Her sliver armor, once pure and simple was now black, heavy and bulky. Her armored gauntlets now were similar. Her blue gown she loved was now tainted black. Her green eyes were now yellow and bloodthirsty. Bu Sakura was right, she did indeed feel refreshed more alive with a grand new purpose:

To give birth to Angra Mainyu.

Saber still in sitting in her new throne, sees Sakura who was now kneeling before her. “My Queen, how are feeling?”

Saber smiles after taking in the air as if truly breathing for the first time, “Like a brand new person and….” The black knight touches her armor, where her navel is located. There was nothing noticeable there but a mother knows when she is expecting. “My child is demanding nutrition.”

“Very well, should we head out now?” Sakura asks.

Saber considers her options as her stomach rumbles. Her child is hungry; while she could eat mundane human food she knows would not be enough to fully nourish her developing child. It would require the energy of other servants and perhaps their Masters to help the child grow. Also looking around the cave, Saber notices how dreary it is, if she was to have a child they would require a more suitable place worthy of a queen. Perhaps she should take over the shrine above them, which Caster used to reside in before being killed by her hands and expel those monks residing it? There are not many servants whom could take her on currently so perhaps she should just charge ahead? It might be better to try and satisfy her child for now with human souls for now and have Sakura and Assassin scout the situation.
Coming to a decision, the queen decides to…

1133311.content:
What is the essence of despair?

"Saber, by my Command Seal, destroy the Holy Grail."

"...wha?!"

Is it the realization when all is lost?

Saber's mind could barely process what she just heard. Even as the turbulent winds of Invisible Air dispel, exposing Excalibur in it's radiant glory, the King of Knights can scarcely believe her orders as light accumulates within her blade. Eyes color the finest of emeralds widen in surprise, and dread as she finds her body obeying the will of the Command Seal. The realization of what is about to happen made the blonde begin to struggle with all her might. Her body cries out in agony over the conflicting need to resist/obey as Saber's own willpower and Magic Resistance fight against a power than can instill something close to an absolute miracle.

Is it when your absolute best is still not enough?

"Why? Kiritsugu-Why this? WHY THIS?!" The blonde cries out even as she is force to raise her blade overhead. At this point, it would be consider a miracle upon itself that the young woman hasn't brought her sword down already. Despite her slender figure, torrents of pain lash across her form as she struggles against Kiritusugu's order.

Yet despite the intense pain, Saber could only look at her true Master in shock. Her mind trying and failing to rationalize it. She knew of her Master's desire for the grail. Why, at the end, does he choose now to reject it?

At the moment it is just the two of them. Herself and Kiritsugu. Tearing green eyes look into dull black. She heard the indignant shouts of Archer, something about a wedding, but she didn't care about that. All she can do is just look Kiritsugu straight in the eye with a pleading look. Even in the slight crimson glow of the Command Seals illuminates the Magus Killer's visage, Saber cannot read the stone wall look on the man's face.

She sees the man speak once more, and Saber can feel reality come crashing down on her.

"Saber, I command you-"

"STOP!"

Or is to watch all that you have worked for be reduced to dust by someone you considered an ally?

"-destroy the grail."

Saber's efforts crumbles immediately. Kiritsugu's final order combined with the crushing presence of a second Command Seal demolishes the King of Knights in an instant. Her arms strikes downward, unleashing Excalibur's full might at the golden chalice. Radiant prana lashes forward, vaporizing the Holy Grail almost instantaneously.

The sight, wondrously despite it's destruction, is made unknown as Saber merely closes her eyes. The last strike enough to exhaust her remaining mana, soon her physical form will disappear into nothingness. All she can do know is quietly think on how badly she fail to understand even a single person. From the people she led as a king, to the knights who swore fealty to her, even the lone man she could only scarcely understand from just three orders.

Those were he final thoughts as Saber, known by the many to be King Arthur, disappears into nothingness. Unaware of what is to follow.

XXXXX

It would be at this point did the one known as Artoria Pendragon would vanish upon modern day Fuyuki City. She would then return upon the blood soaked hills of Camlann Hill. Surrounded by the corpses of those she once called allies, even right next to her "son" Mordred. The sight alone would reduce Artoria to tears and soon harden her resolve for the Grail, though this time not to redo her rule but to replace herself entirely. Then on she would then be summoned into the Fifth Grail War by the son of the very man she was betrayed by. From there on the Servant Saber will find out the truth of the Holy Grail and either find love in the strangest of people, find peace with her self and fade away into history, or be corrupted until death puts her out of her misery.

However fate is fluid. Those outcomes are merely a drop in the sea of infinite possibilities that can only be traversed by the Kaleidoscope. In those reflections, Saber merely disappears without a word. In another she merely lets out a quiet thought. A sudden desire. A wish.

"If only I can disappear."

And soon her fate would spiral into a loop of insanity that seeks to keep her lock inside forever.

XXXXX

"If only I can disappear."

Artoria did not know what brought that thought on. Literally she is already disappearing into nothingness. Soon she would fade from the world, the common man unaware or unknowing of her presence. A mere flicker of light that is soon snuff out like a flame from a candle's wick. Already she can feel Excalibur's light washing out meager existence. She would "die" and soon return to that hill.

"Ah." A sudden epiphany.

The King of Knights is almost gone. Only a bit of her head and the tears that fell down her face are left. Even then she would soon disappear as Kiritsugu's order runs its course. Yet still, despite everything, there is some part of her is alive. With what little willpower she has left she speaks out a childish desire.

"I want to disappear."

To disappear into nothingness. Free of pain. Free of failures. Free of all that has plagued her life. It was a childish in a way. To no longer carry the burden she place upon her shoulders, and simply fade away and just let all the suffering wash off of her.

Saber soon vanishes into the ether, and is soon no more.

And yet something, somewhere has heard her final words...and stirs.

XXXXX

Saber, no, Artoria wakes up to the sight wooden ceiling. Green eyes, open wide in shock, as she finds herself staring up at a ceiling of a room she has no recollection of being in. Even more shocking, the aches of pains of her last encounter with Archer and Kiritsugu's betrayal were entirely gone beyond a faint phantom pain. If she be more aware, the blonde young woman would have notice that her clothes and armor are unblemished, pristine as if new.

Despite that all, Saber rockets straight upward. She whips her head back and forth at her new surroundings, an unassuming classroom with a couch she was laying on, trying to rationalize what has happen to her. Everywhere she look she saw no signs of tampering, or traps, or even some sort of magical energy. It was an mundane classroom, sans the couch instead of desks and chairs.

Yet the King of Knights can help but feel everything is just wrong.

Artoria did not know how she came into this space. Taking a few deep breaths to calm her nerves she voices the most obvious.

"Where am I?"

"Why the result of your wish my adorable King of Knights."

The blonde's heart freezes at the new, and yet familiar, voice. Slowly turning behind her, at the room's entrance, Saber sees someone she fail.

"Irisviel?"

Across the room, the Einzbern homunculus gives a radiant smile. Though dress in a pink hakama and having her white hair in a pony tail there was no denying the individual before bears the physical body of Irisviel von Einzbern.

Yet for some reason Saber finds herself on edge. Instinct born of countless battles have hone her senses. Even with the recent despair of what just happen Saber finds herself ready to act.

'Don't be deceived.' Her instincts warn her. 'Do not trust her, or you will suffer.'

Stomaching the fresh pain of betraying her recent friend, Artoria hardens her heart and raises Excalibur at the other woman. "Identify yourself."

"Irisviel" is actually unperturbed at the development. She merely smiles wider, "I am Irisiviel."

Saber steps forward, ready to fight. "Don't deceive me, you may wear her face but you are not her. Identify yourself imposter!"

Again, "Irisiviel" smiles, "Ah, how cute. Very well, I am Irisviel, and yet I am not her. In a way I am merely your guide for this space born of your wish."

Saber raises an eyebrow, "My wish?"

Irisviel's nods, "Yes, you wish to disappear did you not. To be free of the shackles that bind and plague you. Well your wish has been heard and thus here you are."

A look of confusion crosses Artoria's face as she lowers Excalibur. "That...should be impossible." The outcome of the Grail War was obvious.

"Don't worry about the little details Artoria-chan!" Irisviel speaks up, making her way closer. Artoria herself didn't react as the "imposter" pushes Excalibur away from her. "In this space, anything is possible now. Though disappearing sounds a bit too much, you can just stay in here forever if you want. All you have to do is just accept your new home." Irisviel sounds holds out her hound to Artoria, as if greeting a friend.

Saber soon goes from confusion to hesitation, "Forever..."

Irisviel grins, "Yep, here, forever. No more King's burdens, no more bad memories, just you and me to your heart's content."

Saber looks at the offering hand, to her sword, and then down at her feet. Part of her wanted to accept, she was a failure as a king, why did she need to continue pressing the fact.

Yet, she also feels that something is wrong. There's something is amiss and if she takes "Irisviel's" hand it's all over.

Looking up to her image of her friend's radiant smile, Artoria comes to a decision.

Artoria felt her clothing tear just at her hips as her legs started to feel the cold winds as her gown shortens in length ending just at her thighs. Her sleeves darkened to a dark blue as well as the rest of her clothing. A red ribbon suddenly grows out of her outfit and blows onto her chin. Her collar also grows out somewhat till it touches her shoulder but still does not show any skin despite the blowing wind. "I do not know about this place, or the full extent of what's going on." Artoria says to the fake-...no, Irisviel before coming to her decision.

With little regard, Artoria ignores her screaming instincts and lowers her sword before willing it away. The blonde young woman gives a brief glance to the disappearing motes of light of Excalibur before looking at the sparkling expression of her soon to be sole companion. Biting down the lingering grief Artoria gives a slight smile, "Perhaps I should stay here, for a while at least."

"Ah, my adorable King of Knights I'm glad you accept this!" To the blonde woman's surprise, the pink clad homunculus springs forward before wrapping her arms around her. Artoria's world became a slight blur as she and her...friend spun around in a sense of celebration. "Don't worry, I'll make sure you won't regret this at all!" The spinning continue for a few rotations before Irisviel slows to a stop before the two of them finds themselves plopping down on the couch. Irisviel laughs with girlish glee as Artoria herself gives a faint chuckle at the faint sound.

It's suppose to warm the King of Knights' heart to see Irisviel laugh again. It should make her heart feel at ease to find her friend smiling and laughing again before...everything. Yet...

'You're being deceived!'

'Run! Fight! Hide!'

'THIS ISN'T REAL!'

'ENOUGH!' The King of Knights clamps down on her hesitation with an iron grip. This space, this realm, is her home now. She has failed her realm, her people, her friends. All because that she was King and failed miserably at that task. She won't go back to that blood soaked hill. Not again...NEVER AGAIN!

"Saber?"

The concern tone of Irisviel makes Saber, no, correction Artoria snap out of her inner turmoil before looking at her friend with a strain smile. "I'm sorry, Irisviel. It's nothing really and I'm no longer Saber. You can call me Artoria."

Not Saber.

Not King Arthur, or Arthur Pendragon.

And especially not the King of Knights.

"Just Artoria." The blonde young woman speaks with a sense of finality. Her past, the actions of the King of Knights now no longer applies to her. Excalibur will no longer enter her grip. She will no longer burden the world more with her mistakes. Now she's here, with a friend, in a space that could be best described as limbo.

Ignoring, or perhaps accepting of her friend's plight, Irisviel clasps her hands together in joy and gives a radiant smile. "Okay, Artoria it is then, and you can keep calling me Irisviel in exchange."

Feeling as though the weight of her sins no longer on her shoulders, Artoria leans back on the couch and ponders. Another flex of will and mana forged armor and gauntlets disappear, leaving her in nothing but the blue dress, the last remainder of her prior identity. She should ask Irisviel for a change of clothes later, something feminine this time instead of the dark suit she wore previous. But..."So what's first?"

"Hm?"

Sitting back up Artoria looks at her friend with slight anticipation. "So what do we do first, since we're now together in this place?"

"Ah, that's a good point." Irisiviel looks up a bit as she ponders what to do. A beat later and a flash of inspiration crosses her face, "A party!" Seeing the blonde young woman's look of confusion the homunculus takes Artoria's hands in hers. "Think of this as a celebration of your new life here! We can have games, food, and a bunch of fun stuff you didn't have during your time. True parties are usually with more people, but I bet with the two of us that'll be more than enough!"

Artoria allows herself to slightly wider smile as she tries to share in Irisviel's enthusiasm.

'You can still turn back.'

'Enough.'

With that Artoria accepts her fate.

"So Irisiviel," the no longer King of Knights calls out to her friend, "So what do we need for this party?"

"Another good point." Irisiviel thinks to herself again before smiling once more...

1231.content:
Deep within the Tohsaka Manor, a young woman sits alone inside the Study, her eyes focus on the small crystal fragments lying on the desk in front of her. To the average human the crystal pieces could be classified as "worthless junk" but for a Magus worth her weight in salt those little bits and pieces could hold the key to accessing a power that no level of science can explain.

They were pieces of the Jewel Sword Zelretch, a Mystic Code that could draw a practically endless amount of mana.

Rin couldn't believe her luck when she found fragments on her clothes a few days after the insanity that was the Fifth Holy Grail War. When she detonated the sword as a last ditch move during her final battle she was sure that the code was utterly vaporized in the blast. Perhaps her luck have finally turn out to the better after all the insanity that has happen to her before hand.

A part of her, the part that is Tohsaka Rin the Magus, is already processing the possibilities this finding can bring. The Jewel Sword itself is capable of drawing in infinite mana, despite it being only a cheap copy, the fragments themselves could theoretically be able to do the same albeit diminished to a degree. To unlock the mysteries of these crystal fragments would mean unlocking the mystery that is the Second True Magic. To unlock the Kaleidoscope could also mean one step closer to her goal, the goal of all Magi, to reach the Akasha Records, the Root of all things.

Yet another part of her, the part that isn't Tohsaka Rin the mage or Tohsaka Rin the honor student, but Tohsaka Rin the girl can't even bring up the drive beyond just twiddle the crystal shards between her fingers and checking the cut of the gems. She can only pay half a mind to the little gems and focus more on her personal issues.

The first rule of being a Magus is to walk with death. Their experiments could prove fatal, their research can twists minds into a macabre of insanity and madness, there is always that one possibility that one moment could mean the difference between life or death. She understood that fact, acknowledge it, accepted it as just another fact of being a Mage and still carried herself with grace, dignity, and pride. Yet for all her pride and understanding of what it means being a mage of Tohsaka, it was during the hell that was the Fifth Grail War that she can see the she was still nothing more than a child in the end.

A frown crosses her features. The Grail Wars, within those few weeks she has experienced horrors and madness that will haunt her till the end of her days. She saw the bloodshed it can cause, the chaos it can brew, the damage it can create, all for the sake of one wish...only to find out it was nothing more than a red herring. Still it was not just the Grail war that disturbed her...

"Sakura..." Rin murmurs to herself as she rests herself against the chair she was sitting on. Within those few weeks she found the truth of the HELL that was her sister's treatment at the hands of that despicable clan, Matou. She saw the signs, she saw how Sakura changed from the time she last saw as a child of Tohsaka before being sent away by her own father, but despite her wish to bring back her blood sister one fact cruelly plays in her mind every time.

Such is the life of Magi.

Her frown deepens. In a sense, the Grail Wars and Sakura's condition had one thing in common: Magi. It was Magi that established the Grail Wars and the madness that ensue (not to mention how it is tied in with Emiya Shirou's "condition"), and it was the pride and rules of Magi that made her father gave away Sakura.

She too is a Magus, but a thought plagues her. Will she maybe do the same? To sacrifice what it means to be a decent human just for sake or pride or whatever that is that drives a Magus forward. Just like...

"Like hell!" She shouts as she slams her hand on the desk as in defiance to something, "I am the heir of Tohsaka but I will not go to such extremes like...that." She says the last part as if it was a curse. She turns back to the matter at hand before such hesitations grips her heart once again.

"Now where was I? Oh yeah, putting these pieces back together or something." She tries to regain her posture and grace befitting the not just the Head of the Tohsaka House, but as Tohsaka Rin the magus. She quickly piles the jewel fragments together and goes back to the task at hand i.e. "What the hell am I going to do with these?"

"Despite these shards originally came from something that was only brought into this world by Gradation Air they still exist without being erased by the World." She observes before honing in her senses, "I can still feel power within them, not at the level as the Jewel Sword but still quite a bit. I wonder..." She places a hand above the shards, her magic circuits start circulating with prana, "...since these things are just pieces of a while, I believe that single spell might put them together into a single item." She takes a deep breath, "Was verbirgt sich getrennt (What lies seperated)," the pieces begin to glow, "so einig sein wie eins (shall be united as one)."

The conservation of mass states that the mass of a matter in a isolated system will remain constant over time. So theoretically, just combining some jewel shards together into one gem, the product will have the same mass as the components that were used in its creation.

Apparently modern science didn't take into account the little black box that is the Kaleidoscope.

The pieces converge and emit a bright, Rin only had a fraction of a second to see a reaction coming from the gems before...

BOOOOOOOOOOOM!

A bright blast of prismatic light shines forth as the jewel shards somehow detonated themselves...with equally expected results.

A blast wave sends the red-clad mage back away from her desk into a nearby wall. Normally such an event could possibly cripple anyone, but a Magus skilled in Reinforcement will be only dizzy, slightly blinded by the light, ears ringing from the explosion, and a bit sore from the hit.

"Well," she blows a tuff of hair out of her eyes, "That was a...set back." Not missing a beat she picks herself off the ground and makes her way to the desk, grimacing as she finds her work bench has been reduced to wooden planks and scraps. "Damn it, these things get expensive." She moans the lost of her work station before checking out her own body. "No cuts or bruises building up. My circuits all are in perfect shape. Strange, no way can I emerge from this accident practically unscathed." She furrows her brow and waits a few moments, inspecting herself for any delayed after effects.

Picking up the gun, Ilya gives the tool a long glance, observing the many complexities of its design. Unlike the many firearms her father, Kiritsugu,had infamously used, she'd never seen anything quite like this. In fact, it almost looked like a child's toy. Then again, what did she know about modern day weapons? But that still begs the question, what was something like this doing in a storage room meant to hold enchanted tools? Last she checked, bar her father, no magus had been known to even glance at modern day weaponry, deeming it inferior. So many questions, and only one way to get them...

Looking around, she tried to spot something that could be used as a target. Before she could settled on a bullseye, she turned to see an automated golem rushing her.
"Most likely the security system" she thought to herself. Looks like the system made her choice a lot easier. She smirked, pointing the gun at the still rushing contraption.
"Hope Sella and Leysritt won't mind the extra work" she thought. Unfortunately it seemed like fate had other plans for her.

She pulled the trigger once, twice, and would have squeezed it again had she not been about to get pulverised by the now encroaching golem! Figuring safety overtook her curiosity, she instinctually reinforced herself quickly and tried to put as much distance between herself and her attacker. Managing to put roughly ten yards of distance between each other, Ilya caught her still held breath, allowing oxygen to finally flow through her again. Keeping her magic circuits running, she prepared a spell to obliterate her aggressor. That was another mistake. Not being very well versed in hand to hand combat, any opportunity given to an opponent will be exploited, and exploit it the golem did. Having not put enough distance between them, she only had realised her mistake as she saw the golem overtake the distance between them in a heart beat. Seeing it wind up its massive arm as it came within striking distance, Ilya used the only other thing at her disposal. She remembered her father talking to her about reinforcement magic, and how it can be used to, well, reinforce objects as well. However, done incorrectly, said object can explode if there is too much mana running through it. In a last ditch attempt, she closed her eyes on instinct and reinforced the gun, hoping to detonate it.

… Nothing happened. She quickly opened one eye, hoping that the golem had missed. Instead, she found herself staring at a golem that appeared to be missing the limb used to strike. No wait, that's incorrect, while it looked that way, upon closer inspection one could see a tiny arm where the large arm was supposed to be. It almost looked comical, and it would've been funny if the golem, now recovered, hadn't decided to throw it's other arm at her. Now Ilya, being the smart woman that she is, put two and two together and, while grinning mischievously, fired again with her circuits running. Hitting it's other arm, she could see it's size dwindling as it neared closer and closer, until it was no bigger than it's other arm. Now confident in her victory, she fired again, this time it hitting the poor security contraption dead-center. Like previously observed, the golem started getting smaller and smaller, until it was no bigger than her hand.

"Awww, you're just adorable like this!" She exclaimed as she picked up the now toy sized golem. The golem, seemingly annoyed with her attempts at mockery, tried fighting back, earning a giggle from the loli. "Unfortunately, you'll just keep bothering me, so I'll destroy you now." and proceeded to crush it in her hand. Refocusing her attention on the gun that had both almost killed her and saved her life, she once again looked over the gun "So you make things smaller, huh? And you need to be fed mana for it to work. Makes sense." While she normally would not have felt much from simple reinforcement, she had indeed felt a small strain on her circuits. Finishing her observations, she noted that, there were a set of buttons on the gun, specifically a 'G' and an already highlighted 'S'. Figuring 'S' meant shrink, she immediately deduced that the 'G' must've been for enlarging things.

With this new source of entertainment, Ilya thought "Growing things, shrinking things, ohhhh the possibilities!" She smiled mischeviously, an idea forming in her head...

It was the end.

After countless days and numerous sacrifices, Chaldea had accomplished its goal and ended the singularities, putting a stop to the destruction of humanity and allowing the flow of time to once more continue.

For the rest of the world there was confusion as people returned to life and found that time had advanced a full year despite what felt like the passing of a second.

In Chaldea, however, the mood was nothing short of jubilant, the many staff and servants in the mage organization laughing, drinking, and feasting as they celebrated the salvation of the world.....

Well, most of them at least.

Amidst the revelries in a hastily redecorated cafeteria was a sour-faced young woman with moderately long, pink hair, pale blue eyes, and a pair of curling, draconic horns that, when combined a thick, black scaled tail, made it quite obvious how she was more than human.

She was known as the Countess of Blood, Lancer, and the Number One (Self-proclaimed) Idol of Chaldea, a fearsome girl who'd been summoned in the earliest days of humanity's plight to help her master, a black haired young man by the name of Gudao, beat back all the evils of the world, along with maybe getting in a few gigs to boost her popularity as a songstress.

She'd fought everything from dragons and skeletons to steam powered robots alongside her master and, with each passing day, found herself more attracted the boy as he fought to stay afloat in a situations that was leagues above his head, his determination and steadfastness filling the girl with strange new feelings as he did everything he could to end the temporal anomalies known as singularities.

It was like living in a dream, a terrifying, exciting, and sometimes strange, dream that the servant never wanted to awaken from.

Unfortunately for her, it did.

As time passed, the empty rooms and halls of the organization were filled with more and more people as Gudao summoned new servants to help him in his fight, the newcomers ranging from burly, fierce men to strong, and beautiful, warrior women that distracted the idol's master from her.

A 'distraction' that had eventually led to the petite idol's replacement in her master's team when the time came for the final battle, the young woman watching helplessly as her master left to save humanity with....with....HAGS beside him rather than her.

Even now they still clung to the boy as he tried to survive the wave of congratulations that was breaking upon the young man, laughing, smiling, and pressing those useless bags of fat on their chests against him.

The sight of it made Elizabeth's tail thrash in anger as that 'monk', a term the lancer felt was far to generous considering the amount of skin the woman showed, whispered something into her master's ear that caused Gudao to nearly choke on the drink he had.

"A full figure....BAH! They're just taking the easy way to win over fans!" the lancer grumbled to herself as a certain, and currently inebriated, roman empress stumbled about with a chest that looked to be mere-moments away from escaping her top. "A REAL idol knows that a slim figure is the best kind of figure for attracting men!"

There was energy in the proclamation but it still rang hollow in the pointed ears of the girl, what meager strength she'd built up leaving her all to quickly as she slouched over, her chin resting in her hands and her elbows on her knees as she watched the room, the normally boisterous girl now turned into a wallflower as her master was surrounded by women whose bodies outclassed her in every aspect.

Elizabeth may refer to herself as petite but it was simply a way of making her figure more palpable, a method of coming to terms with the nonexistent chest, twiggy legs, and flat rear that made up her body.

Womanly features were, unfortunately, lost to the draconic servant, the leather straps on her chest and flowing skirt she wore only emphasizing her lack of a figure rather than hiding it.

Normally the lancer wouldn't have cared but time had caused her feelings for Gudao to evolve beyond a simple friendship or bond, it had begun blossoming into an unfamiliar, but not unwelcome, love.....

And right now that flower was being choked out by others that were growing around it.

As the party wore on and her master was eventually dragged away by a few of the other servants, Elizabeth came to a decision.

And, although she was loathe to admit it, she knew just the person.

At the rear of the cafeteria and behind the kitchen counter was the servant's target, a tall man with white hair, tanned skin, and a bright red jacket who was frying up more food for the celebrations with a small smile.

A smile that soon turned into an annoyed frown as Elizabeth greeted him in her usual method.

"Hey Archer, I need your help with something!" the girl said as she pushed through the crowd, a hint of irritation in her voice and her thrashing tail nailing a few party-goers in the shin. "Come on! Stop cooking!"

The man frowned but continued to cook, a small stir-fry sizzling in the wok as he stirred it.

The formal name of the man was Emiya Shirou but he'd long insisted that he be called by his class instead, something that had caused confusion on more than once when the call for 'Archer' had gone out.

"What do you want Lancer?" the servant replied, only the barest bit of attention granted to the girl who now leaned on the counter that separated the kitchen from the cafeteria "If you're here to sing, I would rather do without the headache for a while."

The pink haired girl bristled slightly at the comment on her voice and instead decided to get right to business asking the man, in a voice that was a tad too loud, "What kind of woman do you like?".

Liz wasn't certain if it was possible for someone to choke on nothing but the cough made by the red man and the spatula nearly flying from his hand showed that it must surely be possible for such a thing to occur.

"W-what are you doing?" the man asked once he regained his ability to speak , brows knitted in a frown "Who asks that sort of thing out of the blue like that?"

Elizabeth frowned in annoyance.

"I'm not into you if that's what you're asking!" the pink haired girl returned, long, pink nails drumming on the counter "This idol only has eyes for someone else, so you don't need to worry about trying to live up to my standards!"

The sharp retort, oddly enough, calmed the man down and a brief flash of his eyes between the girl and someone farther back in the room was all it took for realization to dawn on him....Not that he let such a thing pass without a biting retort.

"Well, I do believe that 'I' like girls who don't have the personality reminiscent of a constantly barking dog," the man said with a slightly smug grin, saving the way the lancer's nails tapped against the top of the counter that much hard "a meeker, kinder personality is more 'my' speed."

The empress was well renowned for her long winded tirades about the glories of Rome under her rule and, as such, everyone within Chaldea had slowly developed a 'Nero Survival Instinct' that kicked in once the girl started going, their expression falling slack, their eyes growing dim, and their body shifting into an auto-pilot like state that allowed them to function without requiring them to pay attention to the petite woman...

As the Nero's tirade got into full swing, much of Bathory's brain shut down, including the portion that was informing her of the pain she felt from her overburdened stomach and the portion that controlled her 'fullness', leaving naught but an empty void to be filled with foods.

Thus began Liz's true stuffing for the evening, her blank eyes locked on Nero while her fork shoveled ever greater amounts of food into her gullet, the empress soon leading the girl to another, empty table where they no longer had to worry about the escalating situation that had come about with the Arturias, the girls now at nearly open bloodshed but for the youngest incarnation who still happily picked at her cake.

It was at their new table that Liz's gorging really took hold, the girl clearing her first plate and getting yet another plate with Nero, the empress demanding great plates of food from the red archer in the kitchen who obeyed without question, if only so he could get her to leave sooner.

Bit by bit, the plates began to stack up around the two, along with another addition from Nero.

Wine.

"A fine meal like this needs a fine wine to go with it!" Liz heard in one of the moments where her brain detected something of relevance in the motor mouth's raving, the roman empress's slurring getting worse and her stomach looking a bit bloated in her tight dress. "It raises ones spirits and ensures a healthy body! Good wine's lead to a good life!"

Liz was not unfamiliar with wine, she'd often partaken in the drink at banquets during her life, but she'd yet to truly indulge in such a thing due to the understanding that people wanted a 'Pure, innocent idol, not a drunken, stumbling singer."

She was, however, well aware of what too much wine could do to a person, giving them something far from a 'healthy body'.

A beer belly.

Had she been in a more, fully functioning state of mind, Liz would've rejected her rival's offer of the alcoholic drink but, at this moment, she was not in that state of mind and, as such, she accepted her rival's offer, downing a full goblet and indulging in what could only be considered wanton debauchery.

Goblet after goblet was spilled between the two girls and what was a once the Saber dominating the conversation soon turned into the pair giggling and drunkenly singing side by side as they clattered their goblets together and stuffed themselves full of more food, their dishes having moved from the nutritious meals of Emiya to the empty calories of heavily frosted cakes and sugary pies.

And the effects were plain as day.

What had once been minor bloating and a bit of tightness for the pair had turned into sweet and liquor laden guts that strained against their dresses, the girls looking like they were in early stages of pregnancy, something only allowed by the durability of their bodies.

"Y-you know Ne-hic-ro, I really.... REALLY wish I'd done this b-buhfore," came the happy, and heavily slurred, proclamation from the idol, her wide smile showing off her elongated canines "Y-you and me are two of uh kind..."

"U-umu~.... O-on that we can agree Eliz...Elizab....Lizzy." The empress slurred back, the short woman swaying slightly as she rested her hand upon her chest "T-together we could be.. UNBEATABLE!"

There was nothing especially humorous about Nero's near shout but the pair devolved into drunken giggling anyway.

The party was nearly empty by this point as the many people present retired to their rooms, fallen dead asleep or, in the case of all Artorias but lily, driven themselves to exaustion....but Gudao still remained, the tired looking young man sitting around a small gathering of servants.

Perhaps it was the alcohol or perhaps it was her patience finally reaching its limits but either way, the outcome was the same for Liz.

Pulling away from her friend, who fell dead asleep as she lay upon the now vacated seat, the lancer class servant drunkenly stumbled across the room until she was in front of her master, the black haired young man noticing her arrival with a surprised, but still warm, smile.

"Liz, are you alright?" the man asked as a bloated, and swaying, girl stood before him, her youthful features locked in a puffy cheeked pout. "I didn't see you all night."

"Well, it doesn't h-hu-help that you've been spending your time with all those other girls..." the pink haired idol slurred, an awkward cough escaping a few of the remaining female servants "I almost thought you'd forgotten about you're number one Idol!"

Gudao was on his back foot but, as always, the young mage reacted quickly, putting up a reassuring smile and gently holding the inebriated girl on her arm.

"I haven't forgotten you Liz, it's just been a long day a-"

"Long?!" came the loud outburst from the servant, her pout now taking a shade of anger "D-do you know how LONG it's been since you brought me out and showed off my talents to the w-world? How do you expect me to b-be an idol without an audience?"

A deathly quiet seemed to fall over the party as the lancer's indignant complaints continued, the girl listing off all the days she'd waited for him to call upon her and her spear once more, the man sitting and taking it all in.

"I was one of the first to help you out and now I've been left behind! Forgotten!" the idol drunkenly raged, her scaled tail thrashing as she wobbled from side to side "Well, if you think you can forget me! Then try and forget this!"

All that Gudao managed was a surprised 'wha-' as Elizabeth Bathory, the Blood Countess and Lancer class servant, fell onto him and gave him a deep, wine-tinted kiss....promptly before falling asleep atop his chest.

---------

Pounding, thunderous and painful was the sensation the greeted Elizabeth in the morning when she awoke, a splitting headache unlike any other she'd had before welcoming her into the new day.

"S-shoulda held back...." the girl moaned, her hand coming to her head to nurse the painful drums playing in it "N-never gonna drink again.."

Slowly, and painfully, Liz managed to open one of her pale blue eyes, fighting against to the harsh light to find herself.

There was no mistaking it, the trademark lack of decoration marking the room as none-other than her master's, although it certainly helped that the idol was resting upon a very familiar chest and wrapped up in an extremely comforting arm.

"M-master's bed! I'm in master's bed!" Elizabeth cheered to herself in her head, her face flushing pink "I-I made it!"

Not wanting to waste such a golden opportunity, the small bit of embarrassment Liz felt about laying on the half-clothed man's chest was shoved into the furthest reaches of her mind as she nuzzled deeper into the blankets, enjoying their shared warmth while ignoring her upset stomach and pounding head.

How long had it been since they last did this?

A two months? Three?

It had taken some time in the early days for the pair to become comfortable enough for such a thing, and even then they'd done it rarely, maybe once or twice a week at most.

Liz had loved those days, the feeling of skin upon skin, although her pride as an idol had prevented them from taking it any farther, their late nights spent cuddling instead of performing more...carnal acts.

"Although, I m-may, MAY consider it once I win him back," the lancer thought as, the still sleeping Gudao pulled her tighter in his sleep "j-just to make sure he's m-mine!...IF he asks....Maybe..."

Ok, she may not have been one hundred percent certain about going through with such an act, she wasn't the debase empress after all, but a small opening in a door had been opened.

For fifteen minutes the draconic girl enjoyed the feeling of her master, the thumping of his heart, the slow in-hailing and exhaling of his breath, her slim hips lightly wiggling and the thick, fin tipped tail she had wagging all the while, a peaceful bliss.

A bliss that was all too soon shattered when the intercom in the boys room crackled to life, the familiar voice of Da Vinchi calling the man down to 'mission control' for a meeting, the boy groaning a bit before finally awakening with a sigh, his arm rising to the run his hands through the hot pink locks of Elizabeth who, in the hopes of getting some more 'me' time with him, feigned slumber.

'Just a few more minutes!' the idol thought, the girl doing her hardest to look relaxed 'Let that weirdo wait! You have me!'

And for a time, the girl's master stayed, stroking her hair and holding her close as he quietly mused on some thought all his own.

Still, duty called and it wasn't too long before Liz was left alone in the bed, her master hastily dressing himself as quietly as he could, the girl now sporting an irritated pout.

"Stupid Chaldea..." the girl muttered, enjoying the lingering scents of the man in his bed "He saved the world! Can't he get some time off?"

There was no reply...

It was only when the dying warmth of Gudao finally left the sheets did Liz stand from the bed and inspect herself to see last nights results.

They were...underwhelming.

Still left dressed by her master, an act that left the girl feeling happy but disappointed, Liz found that her chest was still flat, her thighs still trim, and her rear still small, the only hints of last-night's gorging being a small, poochy belly in place of her normally flat one.

Liz did not take it well.

"DAMMIT!" she shrieked in anger, arms at her head "DAMMIT DAMMIT DAMMIT! I need hips and breasts not a belly!"

In what could only be described as a childish tantrum, Elizabeth stomped around the room, flailed about, and stomped her feet, the girl venting her frustrations until she tripped herself up, a shrill 'eeeeep!" escaping her as the idol tumbled to the floor with a nasty 'thump'.

"Muuuuuuu..." came the wordless groan, from the dragon as she recovered from the trip, one cheek puffed out in frustration "Stupid Nero and her stupid wine and her stupid 'blah blah blah blah bl...ah?"

Beneath the bed, Liz caught sight of a small stack of magazines numbering no more than three, hidden far enough beneath that a casual glance at the bed would miss them but not far enough that once could miss them if they were laying flat on the ground.

Curiosity over-road common decency and, in a flash, Liz was holding the magazines and sporting an expression that could only be described as complete and utter shock.

Her hands were trembling, her eyes wide, and a small 'awawawawa' sound emanating from her lips as she turned evermore red.

Pictures of women that could only be described as 'large' filled the pages of the well worn pages of the magazines, their bodies soft and plump, women who looked the exact opposite of the idol.

Heavy, perky breasts sat upon full bellies and wide hips flared out skirts that revealed panties stretched to their limits by rears that could fill two seats at least.

And those were the REAL girls, the drawn ones were far bigger than that, some of them so big that Liz doubted they could move had they existed.

Page after page they came, their acts ranging from the 'innocnet' (resting half naked on a beach towel' to the obscene (one drawing showing a large, belly heavy woman coupling with a normal sized man), each picture causing the girl to short-circuit a little more, her mouth eventually remember its vocabulary and spitting out "Pervert!", "Pig!", and "Idiot!" with increasing speed she finally gave out and slammed the magazine she most recently held shut, her sharp-nails leaving small tears in the paper and steam practically pouring from the girl's pointed ears.

The dragon idol was at a lost, her mind still shocked beyond thought.

"Master likes fat women...." She mumbled, looking down at her knees "Master likes fat women...."

But then, it happened, the gears began to turn and Liz's gaze turned towards the small pudge that softened her, otherwise unnoticeable, stomach.

"Master likes fat women! Thats it!" She shouted in triumph, her hands in fists and her mouth sporting a wide grin "That's how I'll get him back!"

The goal remained the same but the methods had changed.

No longer would Liz go for a 'womanly shape', she would simply go for a larger one!

A bigger one!

As Liz bolted from the room, a small voice in the back of her asked what would happen to her career as an idol.

It was answered in traditional Liz fashion.

'My singing voice will handle it! My siren song will make them overlook something so petty as a few pounds!'

It may not have worked for anyone else but for Liz, that answer was enough to justify what was about to happen....

Although how it was going to happen was the real question.

Half following and half pulled into Nero's room, Liz was struck by how gaudy the bedroom was, a mixture of gold gilded furniture, bright red cloth, and sculpted busts of the empress decorated every corner of the room.

It was as if the once simple bedroom had been turned into a self-indulgent shrine for Nero, the ego stroking so strong that even the saber's companion felt it was a bit much....if only because she had more things than Liz herself.

While Nero was digging through her room for 'cleaning aids', rose petals, fancy soaps, etc., Liz picked her way through the room, looking for something that wasn't gilded or sporting Nero's face, a formidable task that killed time, if nothing else.

"So, what are you actually planning for today?" Liz asked, eying up a group of phoenix feathers that had been glued together in the shape of a heart "Are we going to practice singing or something? Because I was hoping for something involving snacks."

"Of course we will have delicacies! Who do you think I am?" Nero responded, still rummaging through her belongings in a position that exposed her panty clad rear in all its glory "And as for what, I was planning on gathering some other companions and engaging in some, how did Praetor put it, 'moral building'."

Elizabeth put that answer in the 'clear as mud' category and continued picking through the room, her eyes shifting absentmindedly from item to item until one in particular caught her attention.

Sitting atop a bed-stand next to Nero's 'Empress' sized bed (a queen sized one that she refused to call by its proper name), was a simple, metal picture frame.

It was like finding a plastic cup amongst fine china, nothing about the thing marking it out as particularly special or valuable, its contents little more than a smiling Nero that was hugging a surprised looking Gudao, the former holding the latter's arm between their chest.

It sent Liz's rival senses tingling as she picked up the picture, noting the numerous finger prints, and in one case a kiss mark, that smudged the glass.

A plastic cup it may be, but amongst all those other valuable glasses, it was by far the owner's favorite.

'I wonder if she likes master like I do,' the idol wondered, setting the picture down as Nero let out a shout of triumph 'I know that she started staying a lot more when the others were summoned.'

Further pondering was put to an end quite quickly, however, for as soon as the lancer turned around, she watched as Nero began to undress in full view of her friend.

"Umu? Why should I be ashamed of a thing as beautiful as my body?" the green aired empress asked, her hands on her hips and her body bare "If anything, I feel pride in showing my subjects such a fine figure!"

Sporting an hourglass shape with perky, grapefruit sized breasts and wide, childbearing hips, Nero had little about her body to be semiconscious about.

Her skin was flawless, her rear pert and sizable, and even her intimate areas where made appealing by neatly trimming what hair was there.

It made Liz, who still hadn't fully come to terms with what she was doing and the minor amount of pudge she now held, pout a bit in frustration.

"Ah~, you really are my fated rival Elizabeth," Nero sighed as the dragon stood nude before her, the
draconic girl covering her breasts and secret place as best she could "Even with your...lacking figure, you still manage to make up for such a thing."

"Well not ALL of us can look like they're part cow!" Liz barked back, her thrashing tail nearly knocking over some of the roman ruler's things.

And that something was to lie through her teeth.

Liz was speechless.

"Big, small, flat or chesty, I love all women as long as they are cute!" Nero continued, her declaration loud and proud "Men as well! Although I get a bit more picky about them."

Liz continued to remain silent, standing there in shock until she was finally dragged into the roman empress's private bath.

"Isn't this a bit much?" Liz asked, eyeing a large cake that stood taller than she was, "I mean, where did you even get this stuff?"

"None can refuse the will of an empress!" the saber responded, arms crossed and a smug grin on her space.

"So you basically robbed the store room and bullied that red archer into baking this?" Liz sighed, her palm meeting her face in exasperation.

"He was following a command from his Empress," the blonde repeated for emphasis, the girl's ego in full control "and I 'requisitioned' them. I'd never stoop so low as to steal!"

"Oy! Who care's how she got it, I say we dig in and start dealing!" came a loud, rough, but feminine, voice from the curved couch at the center of this decadence.

"Yeah!" came another, deeper voice from the couch "Lets get this going!"

A third voice joined in but it was simply giggling rather than speaking, its voice far higher than the other two.

With a shrug, Liz joined her newfound compatriots at the couch, Nero following with a skip.

Recruited for the 'Bonding' by Nero, Liz found herself sitting with three newcomers to the pair's misadventures, two girls from the class known as rider and one from the class known as assassin.

Her features were far more feminine than rider Drake but, in return, her hips were less pronounced, giving her a gentle curve, and her chest was FAR less pronounced, being only modest B-cups.

She was big.

VERY big.
